intro: Borreria decipiens, commonly known as the "false croton," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woods. Borreria decipiens is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its use in traditional medicine.
